user.bio: I love Food & I love to Drink...as a daughter of the Greek God Baco, I honor him by due diligence of excesses! Cheers!
Craft beer hunter/ co inventor of the hula-hoop
La mediocridad del ser humano, hace de uno mismo el perder cualquier esperanza.
I like all beer and people who drink beer. Sours are still a bit of a challenge but so are sour people.
Porters & Stouts preferred but IPA's & IPL's are growing on me. Anything with 4 and up I'll drink again...
You can't drink all day if you don't start in the morning. KCCO Let me know if you're traveling, I have timeshare weeks.

beer.beer_description: The subtle malt backbone combats the bitterness and intensity of floral, grassy, and citrus hop flavors. However, taste is perception. What‚Äôs your slant?

This dry-hopped ale combines caramel and 
biscuit malt flavors in happy equilibrium with 
late addition American hops. The 
approachable balance is intentional although 
the name is a ‚Äúhoppy‚Äù accident.

Specialty malts bring intimations of brown sugar and vanilla which meld into the Gnarly‚Äôs character. Roasted coffee malt flavors and residual sweetness dance in harmony, obscuring the line between brown ale and porter.
The lightest of the offerings at MadTree. There's nothing terribly fancy about this beer, but at 4.7% ABV and 11 IBUs, it's a very light, crisp, and approachable beer.

At Galaxy High, the beer has 120 IBUs, 10.2% ABV yet finishes nice and dry. Join two New Zealand hops as you encounter a crazy collection of tropical and dank flavors throughout this Imperial IPA. It‚Äôs big on your palate‚Ä¶ disruptive even. Think "trophic cascades" disruptive.

The conditions have to be just right for the formation of Thundersnow. Ginger, nutmeg and vanilla, hints of cinnamon and a bready malt sweetness create a storm of flavors. When you find this rare occurrence, savor it as long as you can.

There are three things we have learned to never discuss with people here: religion, politics and The Great Pumpkin, But that doesn't mean we can't welcome our own Great PumpCan. So sing pumpkin carols and enjoy MadTree's way of delivering some delicious pumpkin pie flavor right to your gullet.
Citrus and piney notes burst forth on top of an earthy and spicy rye flavor. As the ice melts away from your cans, meet life head on this spring with a Sprye in hand.

Whether you drift along in life, drift down the river, or just want to drift through a drinking session, Sol Drifter will let you go where you want by delivering subtle citrus hop flavors to complement a crisp, refreshing, tart finish.

Not a ray of light penetrates the soul of this 
beer. Combining the roasted malt backbone of 
a Porter with a huge amount of earthy and 
citrusy hops typical in many IPA‚Äôs, this unique 
ale will leave you questioning its identity and 
maybe yours.

The Siberians believed there was a ‚ÄòWorld Tree‚Äô that served as the Axis Mundi, connecting the different worlds through its roots and branches.  While this Russian Imperial Stout isn‚Äôt necessarily the world‚Äôs cosmic axis, it does connect rich flavors in a way to deliver you a cosmic beer

BlackTart Stout is a collaborative effort among fifteen Cincinnati, Ohio breweries as part of the celebration during Cincinnati Beer Week. 

An amalgamation of breweries. A dichotomous combination of flavors. Tart and refreshing yet full bodies and malty. It‚Äôs not black magic, it‚Äôs BlackTart.

Brewed with cinnamon, lactose, and blackberries.
